body_text:
Currently, preference experiments write new values to preferences that are being experimented on. Historically, Firefox has had issues with experiments or fixes that write user preferences, because they persist between versions and are hard to detect vs user preference changes that we want to respect.
By default, preference experiments should be modifying the default value for preferences that are being tested. Because changes to defaults do not persist between sessions, the add-on will have to modify these values at startup as well.
We will still need the option to change the user value for a preference for things that read preferences before the add-on finishes initialization, as is probably likely for Quantum features in Firefox. This can be a toggle/option input in the admin interface, but should have a warning of some kind to make sure users know the risks of running a preference experiment that sets the user value of a preference vs the default value.

title: Option to change default preference value for preference experiment
body:
Currently, preference experiments write new values to preferences that are being experimented on. Historically, Firefox has had issues with experiments or fixes that write user preferences, because they persist between versions and are hard to detect vs user preference changes that we want to respect.

By default, preference experiments should be modifying the default value for preferences that are being tested. Because changes to defaults do not persist between sessions, the add-on will have to modify these values at startup as well.

We will still need the option to change the user value for a preference for things that read preferences before the add-on finishes initialization, as is probably likely for Quantum features in Firefox. This can be a toggle/option input in the admin interface, but should have a warning of some kind to make sure users know the risks of running a preference experiment that sets the user value of a preference vs the default value.
